definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: Players can now turn in one of each battleground mark for an honor reward.
sentences.chinese: 現在玩家可以用4大戰場的徽記各一個來換取榮譽。

sentences.english: The WHO logo on a technical document is a stamp of trustworthy authority.
sentences.chinese: 技術文件上世衛組織的徽記是可靠權威的標誌。

sentences.english: Do you see that woman with the embroidered badge?
sentences.chinese: 你看見那個佩戴刺繡的徽記的好人了嗎？

sentences.english: Symbol of Faith is a guardian hammer skill.
sentences.chinese: 虔信徽記是守護者槌技能。

definition: lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
to stir up public sentiment by false statements (idiom)/to resort to demagogy
to be reluctant to give up a post
